nodes.title: Import Feature
nodes.description:
<description><heading>Sample JSON for Import</heading><codeBlock>{
  "nodes": [
    {
      "id": "import_feature",
      "title": "Import Feature",
      "description": "<description><heading>Sample JSON for Import</heading><codeBlock>{\n  \"nodes\": [\n    {\n      \"id\": \"node1\",\n      \"title\": \"Node Example\",\n      \"description\": \"<description><paragraph>Example of a node field.</paragraph></description>\"\n    }\n  ]\n}</codeBlock>"
    }
  ]
}</codeBlock>

nodes.title: Node
nodes.description: <description><heading>Node Field</heading><paragraph>The "node" field defines an individual unit in the system. Each node must have a unique "id" and may contain nested nodes, a title, and an optional description.</paragraph></description>

nodes.title: Flow
nodes.description: <description><heading>Flow Field</heading><paragraph>The "flow" field represents a sequence of processes. Each flow consists of "initial_inputs", "steps", and other metadata required to model the flow interactions.</paragraph></description>

nodes.title: Flow Step
nodes.description: <description><heading>Flow Step Field</heading><paragraph>The "flowStep" field outlines a single step within a flow. It includes inputs and outputs and describes how nodes interact during this step.</paragraph></description>

nodes.title: Description
nodes.description: <description><heading>Description Field</heading><paragraph>The "description" field provides additional information or context for the node, flow, or flow step. It uses XML-like tags for formatting.</paragraph></description>
